member.name: T:MonoGame.Extended.Graphics.Effects.EffectResource
member.summary: Reperesents the bytecode of an that is encapsulated inside a compiled assembly.

remarks.para: Files that are encapsulated inside a compiled assembly are commonly known as Manifiest or embedded resources. Since embedded resources are added to the assembly at compiled time, they can not be accidentally deleted or misplaced. However, if the file needs to be changed, the assembly will need to be re-compiled with the changed file.

To add an embedded resource file to an assembly, first add it to the project and then change the Build Action in the Properties of the file to Embedded Resource. The next time the project is compiled, the compiler will add the file to the assembly as an embedded resource. The compiler adds namespace(s) to the embedded resource so it matches with the path of where the file was added to the project.

member.name: P:MonoGame.Extended.Graphics.Effects.EffectResource.DefaultEffect
member.summary: Gets the embedded into the MonoGame.Extended.Graphics library.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the embedded resource. This must include the namespace(s).
The assembly which the embedded resource is apart of.
